titleStmt.title: Methodi practicæ specimen An essay of a practical grammar; or An enquiry after a more easie and certain help to the construing and pearcing of authors; and to the making and speaking of Latin. Containing a sett of Latins answerable to the most fundamental rules of grammar, and delivered in an easie method for the first beginners to make Latin, at their entrance on the rules of construction. By Christopher Wase, M.A. teacher of the Free-School at Tunbridge in Kent.
titleStmt.author: Wase, Christopher, 1625?-1690.

titleStmt.title: Methodi practicæ specimen An essay of a practical grammar; or An enquiry after a more easie and certain help to the construing and pearcing of authors; and to the making and speaking of Latin. Containing a sett of Latins answerable to the most fundamental rules of grammar, and delivered in an easie method for the first beginners to make Latin, at their entrance on the rules of construction. By Christopher Wase, M.A. teacher of the Free-School at Tunbridge in Kent.
titleStmt.author: Wase, Christopher, 1625?-1690.

editionStmt.edition: The fifth edition corrected and amended.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by A. Maxwell, and are to be sold by Samuel Gellibrand,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in Dr. Williams's Library.
